newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: EnergyDirect s/holders give nod to merger.
newsitem.headline: EnergyDirect s/holders give nod to merger.

text.p: Shareholders in power company EnergyDirect Corp Ltd approved in a special meeting on Monday a merger with Wellington utility Capital Power Ltd.
EnergyDirect is 41 percent owned by TransAlta of Canada, which also owns all of unlisted Capital Power.
The merger will form a new company, TransAlta New Zealand Ltd, in which TransAlta Corp will hold a 63 percent interest.
Shareholders at the meeting approved five resolutions paving the way for the merger to go ahead on October 1.
Ratings agency Standard and Poor's last Wednesday said it had assigned its 'A' long term and 'A-1' short term ratings to Transalta NZ.
It said the preliminary ratings reflected TransAlta NZ's expected solid financial profile and outlook, its stable business environment, and strong operational performance.
S&P said that after the merger, TransAlta NZ woud be New Zealand's fourth largest electricity supply comopany.
